![Image contains the City's vision statement](https://www.lakestevenswa.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentID=12616 "Image contains the City's vision statement")






1. The City's annual event returns to North Cove Park, on Saturday, December 14, 2025, from 4 - 7 pm.
   Read on...
2. #### [Meet up with the Mayor](https://www.lakestevenswa.gov/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=1021)

   Community members are invited to join Mayor Brett Gailey at the Starbucks next to MOD Pizza at Frontier Village in Lake Stevens in November.
   Read on...
3. City offices will be closed on Tuesday, November 11, 2025, to observe Veterans Day.
   Read on...
4. To complete the Phase II construction project, Frontier Heights Park will be closed November 3, 2025 - February 2026.
   Read on...
5. Effective October 20, 2025, The City of Lake Stevens owns and manages Cavalero Hill Park.
   Read on...
6. The community is invited to the PROS Plan open house on November 10 at The Mill on Lake Stevens in North Cove Park.
   Read on...
7. #### [Lake Stevens Plan for Salmonid Basins](https://www.lakestevenswa.gov/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=1020)

   We need your help through this planning effort!
   Read on...
8. The online auctions will open November 11 and 12, 2025.
   Read on...
9. Are you planning an upcoming event and are looking for a venue? Stop by The Mill's Open House on Thursday, November 13, 6 - 8 pm.
   Read on...
10. Snohomish County Parks boat launch access passes will no longer be accepted at Davies Beach, after December 31, 2025.
    Read on...
11. Learn more about the City's 10-year vision for our parks, open spaces, trails, and recreational programming.
    Read on...
12. The Discover Pass will no longer be accepted at the North Cove boat launch, after November 30, 2025.
    Read on...
13. Contact the Parks and Recreation Department for items lost at our Parks.
    Read on...
